Tracing people in his house at 100m of distance is a HARD work, plus go inside your house wich in fist place would be "mega hard" to choose the right house, than issue a order to get in. Case you want to make the thing even harder, you could mix up all your options, TOR -> VPN -> Zeronet, ie.
Is this question purely theoretical? Did you face the problem?

> [falconixx](#comment_6_17ZnSRGrALWLigjaDhkzUM4KAC8c8rv8Eu): it is not theoretical, this is a problem that i am trying to help Persian people with.

Understood. I don't know anything about Persians, nor their network infraestructure, wifi saturation or the level of risk you're trying to get in. I don't know wich kind of connections are trully censored at all.

Also, i am not getting if this is about to use networks as a regular use, or just to being able to send little but secret messages over Persian networks.

Im a bit blurried about your real needs.

I think that the most censored country is china, so you could try to investigate how did those chinesses bypassed the censor methods.

so, your question is more related on how to access from one country (uknown? ) to a host on other country (this case Iran).

**The first attemp should be to use a proxy/vpn that is neutral or accesible from both countries.**
Accesing a VPN is less "ugly" than try to access TOR, so if VPN is not prohibited or truly censores, you should be able to find some working.

I mean, that if you have serious troubles with TOR, then you won't flag yourself as a TOR user, the beset way is to find a "lets say legal" way that is not yet closed. It's virtually impossible to block all VPN providers. Just keep digging.

If you waste so much time and resources, then you have a bigger problem.

Tor let's you connect in many ways, concerning to your case, using bridges, that are people sharing their personal network as bridge for you, so you're not connecting to TOR via direct TOR nodes, you're using a middle network which is a NORMAL network, that connects you to the TOR network.

If you can't use a bridge, then your network is HIGHLY censored. If you really need to access a website, you could try using hostpots or whatever you can use.

As i mentioned, i don't know what's the content of such website, or the need of access such data.

As a final comment, i would comment you the existence of proxychains, which is a piece of software that just chains proxy over proxy over proxy over proxy, etc, up to "lot of them". You could make a connection to Iran jumping the whole world using those free proxies. You should check wich one to put it first (so connection gets out if your country, and which one last, that should be able to connect to iran). It's fking hard to trace back 300 proxies against the whole world. 

Depending the nature of the data, and if this data identifies you directly, it should be a viable bypass to obtain data keeping anonimity. The better if you use a good SSl cert on the webpage, and even better if you serve data ciphered and offer a key for those special users.

> [mmtech](#comment_7_1K8NrwqEfy49zAMWzHgywnToZib7PRaQMP): correction:how to access from one country (this case Iran ) to a host on other country (unknown?).+privacy about IP revealing and stuff is matter because the consequences of using bypass tools exist.

Then you're talking about extremely dangerous data access.

Is this connection used to be regular (lika a chat) or it is just about sending private data in an anonym way (ie, little data, once a day)?

As i pointed, used in China. China is a big censor.

Im seeying that the difference between shadowsocks and any other socks5 proxy, is the fact that everything (including headers, that reveals URL/IP of the site contacted) is fully encrypted by a local proxy (the shadowsocks-client) to the remove server (shadowsocks-server).

This should work, but has a 1 single point of failure. They know nothing about a "suspecting" connection to somewhere, and just needs to block you this IP and you'll be forced to set up new server.

I have to admit that seems the most secure option to a secure proxy. I would put a tor proxy in the "server" side to mix up the outgoing connection instead of use the shadow-server to connect directly to the end point.

Altough read "moderation" seems easy, manage your mind is not that much easy. I don't regret for being abusing my life playing day-by-day, and I don't regret from leave them totally, making me to enter into stress. Usually, stupid people hit the counter-part when trying to avoid something. From playing a lot to don't play. I'm trying to say that i was that (and soo) stupid, but I did just to know both sides, and after that find a comfortable position. Now, I only play when i have nothing more to do, and this happens in a daily basis. I may enter a game, play around 1h-2h and ALWAYS something more important comes to my mind again. I just quit, and I just come back to read, saw movies, or play again when I have nothing more important.

I learned things and concepts that where only possible gaming, and did things that where only possible while not gaming. Find the balance and you may end with something better than just being on an extreme side. 

Again, my experience should not tell you what to do. If you wan't to leave games by yourself, it's your solely decision.

I know I ommited some parts of your message, sorry, I only think important to show my experience and help you with "another" point of view.
